questions.question: I met .............................. at the party but ...................... didn't recognize .................
questions.description: He is a subject pronoun him and me are object pronouns. We use subject pronouns are subjects and object pronouns as objects.

questions.question: I think I have seen ...................... before.
questions.description: Here we use her because the pronoun acts as the object of the verb have seen.

questions.question: You shouldn't have done this to ............................
questions.description: Here we use me because the pronoun acts as the object of the preposition to.

questions.question: Where could ..................................... have gone at this hour of the night?
questions.description: We use 'she' here because the pronoun acts as the subject of the verb.

questions.question: He took .......................... with .......................
questions.description: Here them is the object of the verb took and him is the object of the preposition with.

questions.question: Why don't you listen to ...........................?
questions.description: Here them is the object of the preposition to.

questions.question: No one would have done this except ........................
questions.description: Here him acts as the object of the preposition except.

questions.question: Did anyone see ...........................?
questions.description: Here him is the object of the verb see.

questions.question: All of .............................. arrived on time.
questions.description: Here them is the object of the preposition of.

questions.question: I saw you and ............................ there.
questions.description: Here the pronouns you and her are the objects of the verb saw.
